intro: Micranthes kumlienii, commonly known as the dwarf pincushion, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streamside areas. It has a low-growing habit with hairy stems and small, rounded leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it blooms from late spring to early summer.
